text: Context - free grammars are represented as a set of rules inspired from attempts to model natural languages .[ 3 ] The rules are absolute and have a typical syntax representation known as Backus - Naur Form .The production rules consist of terminal and non - terminal S symbols and a blank may also be used as an end point .
label: Background

text: The Inside - Outside algorithm is an analogue of the Forward - Backward algorithm .It computes the total probability of all derivations that are consistent with a given sequence , based on some PCFG .This is equivalent to the probability of the PCFG generating the sequence , and is intuitively a measure of how consistent the sequence is with the given grammar .
label: Background
